labels.analysis: The MCP Server enables AI agents to fully control remote macOS desktops through comprehensive automation capabilities, including screen capture, mouse and keyboard input, and application management. It allows global access to Macs via Cloudflare Tunnel without requiring additional software installation on the target machine. This infrastructure supports secure, efficient, and autonomous AI-driven desktop operations by providing precise control over UI interactions and application processes.
labels.reasoning: The primary label reflects the server's core functionality of enabling remote control and automation of macOS systems. Secondary labels are included based on the server's ability to handle specific file operations (like application management) and serve as a development tool for AI-driven automation workflows. No custom label is needed as the predefined labels sufficiently cover the functionality.

remote_server_response.error: unhandled errors in a TaskGroup (1 sub-exception)

server_info_crawled.name: Remote macOS Control Server
server_info_crawled.author: @samihalawa/mcp-remote-macos-use
server_info_crawled.overview: Enable AI agents to fully control remote macOS desktops with comprehensive automation capabilities including screen capture, mouse and keyboard input, and application management. Access your Mac globally via Cloudflare Tunnel without installing additional software on the target machine. Streamline remote macOS workflows securely and efficiently for autonomous AI-driven desktop operations.

tools.name: remote_macos_get_screen
tools.description: Deploy Server Remote macOS Control Server @samihalawa/mcp-remote-macos-use Try in Playground remote_macos_get_screen

tools.name: remote_macos_mouse_scroll
tools.description: Perform a mouse scroll at specified coordinates on a remote MacOs machine, with automatic coordinate scaling. Uses environment variables for connection details.

tools.name: remote_macos_send_keys
tools.description: Send keyboard input to a remote MacOs machine. Uses environment variables for connection details.

tools.name: remote_macos_mouse_move
tools.description: Move the mouse cursor to specified coordinates on a remote MacOs machine, with automatic coordinate scaling. Uses environment variables for connection details.

tools.name: remote_macos_mouse_click
tools.description: Perform a mouse click at specified coordinates on a remote MacOs machine, with automatic coordinate scaling. Uses environment variables for connection details.

tools.name: remote_macos_mouse_double_click
tools.description: Perform a mouse double-click at specified coordinates on a remote MacOs machine, with automatic coordinate scaling. Uses environment variables for connection details.

tools.name: remote_macos_open_application
tools.description: Opens/activates an application and returns its PID for further interactions.

tools.name: remote_macos_mouse_drag_n_drop
tools.description: Perform a mouse drag operation from start point and drop to end point on a remote MacOs machine, with automatic coordinate scaling.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@samihalawa/mcp-remote-macos-use/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
